physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman in a striped dress. She is holding a cigarette in her right hand, and holding on to a large bag in her left hand. Behind her, there is a large building on the right. There are no other individuals seen in the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver with large bag
